subject: Leadership
title: Utilitarianism for Leaders
description: A micro-lesson that makes Utilitarianism for Leaders usable.

hook.text: The greatest good for the greatest number. Simple in theory. Brutally complex when you're the one deciding.

buildup.text: Bentham and Mill: maximize overall happiness. Layoffs that save a company might harm hundreds but benefit thousands.

discovery.text: Utilitarian calculus requires predicting consequences. But leaders act with incomplete info and uncertain outcomes.

twist.text: Utilitarianism can justify sacrificing minorities for majority gain. Without guardrails, it becomes tyranny of the many.

climax.text: Use utilitarian thinking as one lens. Always pair it with rights-based checks: who gets harmed and is that acceptable?

punchline.text: The numbers matter. But so do the faces behind them.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of pure utilitarian thinking?
options: It always leads to the best outcomes
It can justify harming minorities for majority benefit
